result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrian Eric-Rashad Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program after serving 18 months.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to 21CM3649 and 21CF4704.

Defendant is informed he may not possess any firearms or body armor.
Defendant is informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.

Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge to be taken out of prison wages at an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections with the balance to be paid during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges to be taken out of prison wages at an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections with the balance to be paid during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrian Eric-Rashad Moore

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Sentencing Hearing (31 pages) commencing 10-20-2022, by Debra A. Wisniewski.

Defendant Adrian Eric-Rashad Moore in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Adrian Eric-Rashad Moore.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1; 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS, consecutive to 21CM3649 and 21CF4704.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge to be taken out of prison wages at an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections with the balance to be paid during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges to be taken out of prison wages at an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections with the balance to be paid during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.;
-no contact with K. J. 

Defendant is informed he may not possess any firearms or body armor.
Defendant is informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program after serving 18 months.
Defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Appeal rights given. Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copies given to defendant. -- gmb

Defendant Adrian Eric Rashad Moore not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland appeared by e-mail for Adrian Eric Rashad Moore.  Attorney Katie Seelow for Jessica Ann Behling appeared by e-mail for State of Wisconsin. Branch 10 in trial on another case. Case adjourned in Branch 10.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adrian Eric Rashad Moore in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Adrian Eric Rashad Moore in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for jury trial.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  State places offer on the record.  Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2, 3, AND 4 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1 : 
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
	
Court advised due to felony conviction, the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant may not vote until civil rights are restored.  Court reminded the defendant that the no contact order remains in full effect.  On State's request, Court ordered the defendant REMANDED for sentencing.

Case adjourned to Branch 10 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Jury Instructions
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Motion in Limine.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Adrian Eric-Rashad Moore in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Adrian Eric-Rashad Moore in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury trial is scheduled for 7-11-22.  For reasons stated on the record, defense is requesting an adjournment of the jury trial date.  Defendant is waiving his speedy trial demand. Court granted adjournment of 7-11-22 jury trial date.  Defense reinstates jury trial demand.  Case is adjourned to 7-25-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.  Jury trial scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Second Notice of Expert Testimony, filed.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Adrian Eric-Rashad Moore not in court, in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Final Pretrial Conference.  Defense counsel advises Court of possible alibi documents to be submitted and requests adjourned final pretrial date.  Defense objects to joinder.  Court will decide joinder motion at next court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; State's Notice of Expert Testimony
Received and Filed. State's Amended Witness List
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Defendant's Notice of Intent to Use Alibi Evidence
Motion for Joinder, filed.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Adrian Eric-Rashad Moore not in court, in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense has entered speedy trial demand.  Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 6-21-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 7-11-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adrian Eric-Rashad Moore in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland; on video.  Defendant Adrian Eric-Rashad Moore in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 21CF4704. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Shelli Zolo. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court by video, defendant Adrian Eric-Rashad Moore not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is unavailable for today. Defendant is in a quarantine pod at HOC. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant.  (Adrian Moore - #2022001698, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

OFF THE RECORD: Parties are not present.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing 2/22/2022. Milwaukee County Office of Emergency Management declared a snow emergency for 2/22/2022 therefore this matter will be rescheduled. A new date has been selected with Attorney Copeland by email. Case is adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with KJ or KAJ
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Adrian Eric-Rashad Moore in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Adrian Eric-Rashad Moore in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adrian Eric-Rashad Moore appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 3 and 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 10. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
